CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, July 30, 1955, pg. 19, reads: "Walter Harper Interviews - Disc jockey Walt Harper last week had greats and near-greats of the jazz world on his program. Left to right: Art Blakey, whose group appeared at the Midway Lounge recently; Walt and Horace Silvers [Silver], pianist with Blakey.  Standing: Jon Morris, trombonist with Walt's orchestra; Skeets Talbot and Earl Mays of the Earl Mays Trio, and Hank Mobley, Art's tenor sax man.  The boys described Walt's WHOD show, 4:30 'til 6 daily as 'the greatest.' - Harris Photo."Art Blakey holds record album "Art Blakey A Night at Birdland" and Horace Silver holds the album "Horace Silver Quintet."
TitMainTitle: Musicians seated from left: Art Blakey, Walt Harper, and Horace Silver; standing: Jon Morris, Skeets Talbot, Earl Mays, and Hank Mobley, on Walt Harper's radio show at WHOD radio station studio
